description: From international scientific vocabulary, from German Bilicyanin; surface analysis, bili- +‎ cyan- +‎ -in. The German word was naturalized into other languages as international scientific vocabulary (e.g., bilicyanin, bilicyanine).

entries.meaning: (biochemistry) A blue (or bluish) bile pigment found in gallstones and formed by oxidation of biliverdin or bilirubin.
